search.query: `cs_oracle` (sourcetype="oracle:audit:xml" OR sourcetype="oracle:audit:unified") | fields host | stats count by host
`cs_oracle` (sourcetype="oracle:audit:xml" OR sourcetype="oracle:audit:unified") | fields user | stats count by user

`cs_oracle` (sourcetype="oracle:audit:xml" OR sourcetype="oracle:audit:unified") | fields vendor_action, ACTION_NAME | eval action_name=coalesce(vendor_action,ACTION_NAME) | stats count by action_name

`cs_oracle` (sourcetype="oracle:audit:xml" OR sourcetype="oracle:audit:unified") | fields object_category, AUDIT_TYPE | eval object_type = coalesce(object_category, AUDIT_TYPE) | stats count by object_type

html.p: Data Collection: Use Splunk Add-on for Oracle for collecting Oracle data.

search.query: `cs_oracle` (sourcetype="oracle:audit:xml" OR sourcetype="oracle:audit:unified") `cs_oracle_privilege_events` $tkn_host$ | fillnull value="-" | eval object_name = coalesce(object, OBJECT_NAME), object_type = coalesce(object_category, AUDIT_TYPE), statement = coalesce(command, SQL_TEXT), status = if(RETURNCODE==0 or RETURN_CODE==0, "success", "failure") | search $tkn_user$ $tkn_action_name$ $tkn_object_type$ $tkn_object$ | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time, event_time)` | rename vendor_action as action_name, DB_UNIQUE_NAME as database_name, DATABASE_USER as db_user | table event_time host user db_user action_name database_name object_name object_type src statement status

`cs_oracle` (sourcetype="oracle:audit:xml" OR sourcetype="oracle:audit:unified") $tkn_host$ | eval schema_name = coalesce(OBJECT_SCHEMA, schema_name), object_name = coalesce(object, OBJECT_NAME), object_type = coalesce(object_category, AUDIT_TYPE), client_app = coalesce(CLIENT_PROGRAM_NAME, client_app), statement = coalesce(command, SQL_TEXT), status = if(RETURNCODE==0 or RETURN_CODE==0, "success", "failure") | fillnull value="-" user object_name object_type | search $tkn_user$ $tkn_action_name$ $tkn_object_type$ $tkn_object$ | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time, event_time)` | rename vendor_action as action_name, DB_UNIQUE_NAME as database_name, DATABASE_USER as db_user | table event_time host user action_name schema_name database_name object_name object_type src db_user client_app statement status
